US government is set to shut down after last-ditch vote fails in Senate
subhead: After the vote, the White House's Office of Management and Budget issued a memo saying 'affected agencies should now execute their plans for an orderly shutdown.' The longest shutdown in history came during Trump's first term, when government functions were halted for 35 days beginning in December 2018.

Death toll from powerful earthquake in the Philippines approaches five dozen as search efforts continue
subhead: The Cebu provincial government has put out a call on its official Facebook page for medical volunteers to assist in the aftermath of the 6.9-magnitude quake. The rescue effort proceeded all night, even as the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said the region was being rocked by 379 aftershocks.

title: Antoine Bouët, economist: 'Has Europe capitulated to Donald Trump? Is this really such a bad 'deal'?'
subhead: The director of the Center for Prospective Studies and International Information (CEPII, the leading French institute for research in international economics) writes in an op-ed for Le Monde that, in a trade conflict, the winner is not the one who raises tariffs the most.

title: 'Cracker Barrel's downfall may seem like a mere marketing blunder, but it reveals something about the conservative wave sweeping the US'
subhead: After daring to update its logo and decor, the American restaurant chain faced a fierce campaign orchestrated by supporters of Donald Trump. Even corporate strategy is not immune to the conservative revolution, writes Le Monde's New York correspondent Nicolas Chapuis in his column.

title: Jafar Panahi, filmmaker: 'To shoot 'It Was Just an Accident,' all of us with our equipment fit into two cars'
subhead: Interviewed in Paris just before the release of his film, which won the Palme d'Or at Cannes, the Iranian director discussed the filming conditions and the threats faced by his team.

subhead: Two investigations launched in France shed light on a disturbing phenomenon originating in the United States: digital spaces where young boys engage in horribly deviant behavior.

title: In Greece, an abbot is arrested for trafficking religious artifacts
subhead: Affiliated with the monastery of Kalavryta, in the Peloponnese, the clergyman was caught as he attempted to sell 14 Byzantine icons and two 18th-century Gospels for the sum of €200,000.

title: 'Zucman tax': The great fear of France's ultra-rich
subhead: Amid budget negotiations, the idea of a tax on the wealth of the ultra-rich is provoking an outcry from those affected, even though it is widely supported by the left and backed by public opinion.
